CARDINAL . The date of a general election is chosen by the incumbent Prime Minister and is normally announced DATE before polling day .

CARDINAL . For electoral purposes GPE is divided into constituencies . Each constituency is represented by a single member of ORG , the person who received the greatest number of votes in his or her constituency . Most candidates are selected by the main , national political parties , although some stand as independent . A candidate ’s nomination for election must be signed by CARDINAL people registered to vote in the constituency . Each candidate must deposit GBP CARDINAL with the constituency returning officer . If he or she does not receive PERCENT of the votes validly cast , this deposit will be forfeited .

CARDINAL . Parliamentary candidates in GPE receive no ORG funding for their campaigns . To safeguard the position of candidates without access to substantial resources , the amount of expenses which may be incurred by a candidate before , during or after an electoral campaign is controlled by statute ( DATE Act , section DATE ) . The amount varies slightly depending on the size of the constituency , but the average is currently GBP CARDINAL . To ensure that this limit is not circumvented , all election expenditure by a candidate must go through an election agent , who is required to submit an account after the election ( CARDINAL Act , sections CARDINAL , DATE and DATE ) .
CARDINAL . Under section GPE ) of the CARDINAL Act , any expenditure incurred to promote the election of a candidate by any person other than the candidate or his or her agent is prohibited :

“ No expenses shall , with a view to promoting or procuring the election of a candidate at an election , be incurred by any person other than the candidate , his election agent and persons authorised in writing by the election agent on account – ( a ) of holding public meetings or organising any public display ; or ORG ( b ) of issuing advertisements , circulars or publications ; or ORG ( c ) of otherwise presenting to the electors the candidate or his views or the extent or nature of his backing or disparaging another candidate , but paragraph ( c ) of this subsection shall not – ( i ) restrict the publication of any matter relating to the election in a newspaper or other periodical or in a broadcast made by ORG ... [ or ORG ] ; ( ii ) apply to any expenses not exceeding in aggregate the sum of GBP CARDINAL . ”

The words “ with a view to promoting or procuring the election of a candidate ” in this subsection have been interpreted by ORG to include the intention to prevent the election of a particular candidate or candidates ( Director of Public Prosecutions v. PERSON [ DATE ] Appeal Cases CARDINAL ) .
CARDINAL . Mrs ORG was charged with an offence under section CARDINAL ) of the DATE Act , which provides :

“ If a person – ( a ) incurs , or aids , abets , counsels or procures any other person to incur , any expenses in contravention of [ section CARDINAL ] ... he shall be guilty of a corrupt practice ... ”

CARDINAL . NORP The maximum penalty for offences tried on indictment under subsections GPE ) and ( CARDINAL ) is DATE imprisonment and/or a fine up to GBP CARDINAL . In addition , a person convicted may be disqualified for DATE from voting in elections , being elected to or sitting in ORG or holding any judicial or public office ( DATE Act , sections CARDINAL ) , PERSON ) and CARDINAL ) .

CARDINAL . Section DATE is concerned only with expenditure incurred in relation to the election of a particular candidate in a particular constituency . There is nothing to prohibit a political party or wealthy individual or organisation from spending money on publicity in support or opposition to a political party or tendency generally , at national or regional level , provided that there is no intention to promote or prejudice the electoral chances of any particular candidate in any particular constituency ( see NORP v. Tronoh Mines [ DATE ] CARDINAL ORG MONEY ) . Nor are there any restrictions on private donations to political parties or on the powers of the press to support or oppose the election of any particular candidate ( see CARDINAL Act , section CARDINAL(CARDINAL)(c)(i ) – paragraph CARDINAL above ) .
